Hello all!
I decided to replay some NWN modules, this time with a cleric. Since I used elves or humans before, I thought to change something...maybe the race; and then, halfling came into my mind (for various aspects: favored class, skill dumps, bonus to saving throws, weapon proficiency also in some martial weapons for favored class).
In my own mind, the build has not only to be a full battle cleric, as I would like some spellcasting (intermediate way between battle cleric and full caster); besides, it is designed for PvM.

posts.content: If you went Rogue 4 / Cleric 26 / CoT 10, you would get one more Rogue skill dump, and a Cleric feat. You could use that Cleric feat and the last CoT feat for 2 more Wisdom.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I would shuffle the pre-epic feats (listing only what is changed):
level 3: Weapon Focus (get that AB bonus nice and early)
level 6: Extend Spell (not very useful when you only have level 1 spells)
level 9: Knockdown (with a low AB very near the beginning, Knockdown attempts will usually miss)
level 12: Blind Fight (the earlier the better, but the above feats are even higher priority)
level 15: Empower Spell (limited usefulness much earlier)

Why are you saving 5 skill points at level 40? You could put those points in Lore or Healing or something at the very beginning (levels 1 and 2) because you are saving at least 5 points at every level. Unless you plan to cast spells during combat, you might be better off with Discipline (a CoT skill) instead of Concentration. Since the last CoT level is at level 35, that would leave 5 more skill points to put on Lore or Healing or whatever skill you chose for the other 5 skill points, for a total of 10 points on that skill, taken at the beginning (maybe Concentration, so it would be useful for a while).

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Empyre, thank you so much for stressing out an important rule, which I often forgot to apply: increase as much as possbile the playability of any build from the earlier levels.
The halfling build previously posted would have, on early levels, had a knockdown with a worse AB, and unused metamagic feats (as there aren't enough spell levels to use both extend and empower spell).
For the skill points question, I have assigned these 5 skill points on the "Healing" skill: by adding the initial wisdom modifier (+3), the level 1 modified "Heal" would be 7 (8 at level 2).
I have maintained the skill points to the "Concentration" skill, as I would like to cast something during fights, however I wil surely take into account using the "Discipline" skill instead of the "Concentration" one.
